title: Master Decision-Making Practices of Fortune 500 Leaders
headline: This free online leadership course will help you master the decision-making practices of Fortune 500 global leaders.
description: Your ability to make suitable and sound decisions will determine whether you reach your business and career goals in this increasingly disrupted post-COVID world. This leadership course will help you acquire the decision-making practices used by Fortune 500 leaders to seize a competitive advantage in the ever-changing workplace. Be taught by a world-renowned decision-making expert who has taught hundreds of leaders and will now train you!

courseDescription:
Are you in a leadership role in a firm but struggle when it comes to decision-making? Do you own a business yourself and are looking to improve your chances of success by making rational and timely decisions? If the answer to these questions is ‘yes’, then you have come to the right place. In a rapidly changing world, making the right decisions at the right time is crucial for success, either as an employee or an employer. Dr Gleb Tsipursky, an authority in this field, guides you in making the most effective decisions to maximise success and avoid major pitfalls. He has worked with the best leaders in the largest firms around the world. His experience in guiding Fortune 500 leaders gives him the perfect portfolio to become your mentor for your future endeavours. The course kicks off by introducing you to the ‘wise decision-makers’ manifesto’. This manifesto guides you on the importance of using your head in decision-making rather than the ‘go with your gut’ mantra. Most great leaders think about their decisions thoroughly before finally implementing them. Dr Gleb provides reasons for how cognitive biases play a critical role in our judgments. He also guides you on avoiding them to get the best out of your long- and short-term decisions.

Have you struggled in the past to make quick decisions? Or made bad career moves that have made a significant impact on your life? This course will help change those decision-making patterns for a better future. Dr Gleb has developed several techniques that you can apply for both quick and long-term decisions in your career. He introduces these techniques in the form of questions or steps that can be applied while making decisions individually or with teams. These techniques ensure that they address the major cognitive biases and consider all possible scenarios before you give the go-ahead. When multiple decision-making options present themselves, he will prepare you with all the right tools. Numerous leaders worldwide have used these techniques as members of Dr Glebs's client portfolio, which has been tremendously beneficial in making the right choices for their firms.

The course will present other strategies for ensuring that you are fully protected from failure and provide you with a safe future. Avoiding major decision-making disasters and future-proofing your firm is key to maximising your success. Dr Gleb will discuss his 8-step model for preventing failure and the 10-step process for protecting your future. Do you find old habits constantly interfering with your decision-making? These intuitive habits and patterns can have a huge impact on your life. With his expertise in cognitive neuroscience, Dr Gleb gives a 12-step model on overcoming these cognitive habits and making effective decisions. It’s common to have colleagues and team members living in denial. He provides a 5-step method for dealing with such colleagues. In the post-covid environment, making the right decisions is crucial. Many businesses and individuals have suffered because they simply were not equipped when it came time to make crucial decisions. This course will help you make the most effective decisions promptly. So don’t waste any more time. Acquire this battle-tested advice from a world-renowned expert and achieve your future goals and aspirations!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

An analysis of how to identify and avoid major judgment pitfalls at the workplace will also be provided.

Making the Best Business Decisions - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Skills To Avoid Failure and Maximize Success
modules.description: In this module, world-renowned decision-making expert Dr. Gleb Tsipursky equips the learner with essential skills and mindset techniques. These techniques and skills ensure that crucial mistakes can be avoided. They also ensure that the future of the business is safeguarded from cognitive biases and other hurdles that hinder sound decisions.
topics: Skills To Avoid Failure and Maximize Success - Learning Outcomes
Avoiding Failure in Implementing Major Decisions
12 Mental Skills to Defeat Cognitive Biases
Skills To Avoid Failure and Maximize Success - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
topics: Master Decision-Making Practices of Fortune 500 Leaders - Course assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes
  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Analyze the difference between rational and intuitive decision making and based on research, how the former is more appropriate in business situations
    • Discuss the role of cognitive biases and their various types in making decisions and how they can affect business leaders
    • Describe the 5-step model that can be used in order to avoid day-to-day judgment errors and make better decisions on a daily basis
    • Outline the 8-step process in order to make major decisions that can have a significant impact
    • Explain the technique used to make a decision involving two or more options and reduce complexity

  • Lesson Summary
    • Dr. Gleb Tsipursky is a Ph.D. in cognitive sciences and has worked with hundreds of fortune 500 firms in ensuring efficient and effective decision-making. 
    • He has published numerous articles as well that have been translated into multiple languages and published worldwide
    • Based on Dr. Glebs' research, it is crucial to make decisions with the head rather than going with the 'gut feeling' or intuition. Our Gut feelings are heavily influenced by judgment errors or 'cognitive biases which can lead to hasty or poor decisions.
    • According to research, there are more than a hundred cognitive biases that affect our thinking process. 
    • Cognitive biases cannot only affect individuals but also groups of individuals in a phenomenon called 'groupthink' where a  group bases its decision on the most influential or loud person within that group
    • Dr. Gleb has developed a 5-step framework that can be applied while making quick everyday decisions at the workplace. This framework makes quick decision-making easier.
    •  The 5 questions are: Has all the important information been considered? Have all the dangerous judgment errors been addressed? What would a trusted advisor suggest? Have all the ways this method could fail been addressed? What new information could cause the decision to be revisited?
  • Lesson Summary
    • Dr. Gleb Tsipursky is a Ph.D. in cognitive sciences and has worked with hundreds of fortune 500 firms in ensuring efficient and effective decision-making. 
    • He has published numerous articles as well that have been translated into multiple languages and published worldwide
    • Based on Dr. Glebs' research, it is crucial to make decisions with the head rather than going with the 'gut feeling' or intuition. Our Gut feelings are heavily influenced by judgment errors or 'cognitive biases which can lead to hasty or poor decisions.
    • According to research, there are more than a hundred cognitive biases that affect our thinking process. 
    • Cognitive biases cannot only affect individuals but also groups of individuals in a phenomenon called 'groupthink' where a  group bases its decision on the most influential or loud person within that group
    • Dr. Gleb has developed a 5-step framework that can be applied while making quick everyday decisions at the workplace. This framework makes quick decision-making easier.
    •  The 5 questions are: Has all the important information been considered? Have all the dangerous judgment errors been addressed? What would a trusted advisor suggest? Have all the ways this method could fail been addressed? What new information could cause the decision to be revisited?

  • Learning Outcomes
  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Define the term 'debiasing' and how it can be used to implement decisions effectively by avoiding failure as well as maximizing the chances of success
    • Analyze the 10-step technique called 'defend your future' that can ensure future-proofing strategic plans and targets
    • Identify the 12 mental skills necessary to avoid making rushed decisions and prevent judgment errors
    • Explain how certain cognitive biases lead people in the organization to be in denial and how certain social skills can be applied to deal with such people in order to make better decisions
    • Discuss the steps that can be used to enhance and apply the skills learned during the course

  • Steps for Continued Learning

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Failure proofing is a strategy developed after studying numerous leaders and companies and can be implemented while making decisions. 
    • The 8 step method used for failure proofing involves gathering the relevant people in the room along with a facilitator and the goal is to assess what can go right and ensure it, or what can go wrong and assess it. All participants provide their recommendations and alternatives and the exercise can be repeated
    • A 10-step technique has been developed by Dr. Gleb known as the 'defend your future' technique used to make strategic decisions. 
    • The steps involved are only applicable if all members are involved, all possibilities are examined and cognitive biases are addressed
    • Another key problem faced in group settings is having people or colleagues around who are in denial. Dr. Gleb provides a 5-step method in order to deal with colleagues in denialism. 
    • The 5 steps to deal with denialism are: using empathy to figure out emotions, Using curiosity to discover colleagues' goals, building a rapport with those in denial, sharing factual information to lead employees away from false beliefs, helping change people's minds through positive reinforcement.
    • The steps and techniques covered can only be perfected through practice. Whether its daily quick decisions or long term strategic decisions, it is best to put these steps and techniques into practice and improve the chances of making more mindful decisions
